title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for sets g'(x) = 0

1 point is earned for the answer

The graph of g has a horizontal tangent line when g'(x) = 0. This occurs at x = 0.163 and x = 0.359.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for sets g'(x) = 0

1 point is earned for the answer

The graph of g has a horizontal tangent line when g'(x) = 0. This occurs at x = 0.163 and x = 0.359.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer

1 point is earned for the justification

g''(x) = 0 at x = 0.129458 and x = 0.222734

The graph of g is concave down on (0.1295, 0.2227) because g''(x) < 0 on this interval.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for g'(0.3)

1 point is earned for the integral expression

1 point is earned for g(0.3)

1 point is earned for the equation

g'(0.3) = -0.472161

g(0.3)=2+ ∫ 1 0.3 g ′ (x)dx=1.546007

An equation for the line tangent to the graph of g is y = 1.546 - 0.472(x - 0.3).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for answer with reason

g''(x) > 0 for 0.3 < x < 1

Therefore the line tangent to the graph of g at x = 0.3 lies below the graph of g for 0.3 < x < 1.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for answer with reason

g''(x) > 0 for 0.3 < x < 1

Therefore the line tangent to the graph of g at x = 0.3 lies below the graph of g for 0.3 < x < 1.
